item.title: Devil May Cry 5 Sales Top 10m Worldwide, Capcom Reveals
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/devil-may-cry-5-sales-10m

Developer and publisher Capcom has announced that character action game Devil May Cry 5 has reached another major sales milestone, a little over six years after its original release.

In a press release, Capcom reveals that Devil May Cry 5 sales have hit the 10 million mark. As usual when it comes to sales figures, these numbers apply across all platforms on which the game is available, and they apply to both physical and digital sales as well.

As for the reason behind the game's strong sales performance, Capcom cites its "exceptional gameplay experience", as well as "efforts to enhance brand awareness by leveraging the title beyond the scope of video games".

Capcom is referring here to the Devil May Cry animated series, which debuted on Netflix in April. According to the studio, Devil May Cry attracted over 5.3 million views in its first week, as well as garnering critical acclaim worldwide. The show has already been renewed for a second season.

If you're unfamiliar with Devil May Cry 5, it is, as the name suggests, the fifth mainline installment in the Devil May Cry series, which began on the PlayStation 2 in 2001.

At time of writing, it's the latest mainline entry in the franchise, and it features three core playable characters across its campaign: series mainstay Dante, Devil May Cry 4 newcomer Nero, and V, a mysterious individual with the ability to command monsters.

In a post-launch update, Capcom also added Dante's brother Vergil to the mix as another playable character; it's possible to play as him throughout Devil May Cry 5's campaign, as well as its Bloody Palace and The Void modes.

If you've yet to check out Devil May Cry 5, you can pick the game up right now on PC, PlayStation, and Xbox, and you can remind yourself what our very own Sam thought of it here.
